00031 btScalar btMachEps()
00032 {
00033         static bool calculated=false;
00034         static btScalar machEps = btScalar(1.);
00035         if (!calculated)
00036         {
00037                 do {
00038                         machEps /= btScalar(2.0);
00039                         // If next epsilon yields 1, then break, because current
00040                         // epsilon is the machine epsilon.
00041                 }
00042                 while ((btScalar)(1.0 + (machEps/btScalar(2.0))) != btScalar(1.0));
00043 //              printf( "\nCalculated Machine epsilon: %G\n", machEps );
00044                 calculated=true;
00045         }
00046         return machEps;
00047 }
00048 
00049 btScalar btEpsRoot() {
00050         
00051         static btScalar epsroot = 0.;
00052         static bool alreadyCalculated = false;
00053         
00054         if (!alreadyCalculated) {
00055                 epsroot = btSqrt(btMachEps());
00056                 alreadyCalculated = true;
00057         }
00058         return epsroot;
00059 }

00063   btVectorXu btLemkeAlgorithm::solve(unsigned int maxloops /* = 0*/)
00064 {
00065   
00066     
00067     steps = 0;
00068 
00069     int dim = m_q.size();
00070 #ifdef BT_DEBUG_OSTREAM
00071     if(DEBUGLEVEL >= 1) {
00072       cout << "Dimension = " << dim << endl;
00073     }
00074 #endif //BT_DEBUG_OSTREAM
00075 
00076         btVectorXu solutionVector(2 * dim);
00077         solutionVector.setZero();
00078           
00079           //, INIT, 0.);
00080 
00081         btMatrixXu ident(dim, dim);
00082         ident.setIdentity();
00083 #ifdef BT_DEBUG_OSTREAM
00084         cout << m_M << std::endl;
00085 #endif
00086 
00087         btMatrixXu mNeg = m_M.negative();
00088           
00089     btMatrixXu A(dim, 2 * dim + 2);
00090         //
00091         A.setSubMatrix(0, 0, dim - 1, dim - 1,ident);
00092         A.setSubMatrix(0, dim, dim - 1, 2 * dim - 1,mNeg);
00093         A.setSubMatrix(0, 2 * dim, dim - 1, 2 * dim, -1.f);
00094         A.setSubMatrix(0, 2 * dim + 1, dim - 1, 2 * dim + 1,m_q);
00095 
00096 #ifdef BT_DEBUG_OSTREAM
00097         cout << A << std::endl;
00098 #endif //BT_DEBUG_OSTREAM
00099 
00100 
00101  //   btVectorXu q_;
00102  //   q_ >> A(0, 2 * dim + 1, dim - 1, 2 * dim + 1);
00103 
00104     btAlignedObjectArray<int> basis;
00105     //At first, all w-values are in the basis
00106     for (int i = 0; i < dim; i++)
00107       basis.push_back(i);
00108 
00109         int pivotRowIndex = -1;
00110         btScalar minValue = 1e30f;
00111         bool greaterZero = true;
00112         for (int i=0;i<dim;i++)
00113         {
00114                 btScalar v =A(i,2*dim+1);
00115                 if (v<minValue)
00116                 {
00117                         minValue=v;
00118                         pivotRowIndex = i;
00119                 }
00120                 if (v<0)
00121                         greaterZero = false;
00122         }
00123         
00124 
00125         
00126   //  int pivotRowIndex = q_.minIndex();//minIndex(q_);     // first row is that with lowest q-value
00127     int z0Row = pivotRowIndex;           // remember the col of z0 for ending algorithm afterwards
00128     int pivotColIndex = 2 * dim;         // first col is that of z0
00129 
00130 #ifdef BT_DEBUG_OSTREAM
00131     if (DEBUGLEVEL >= 3)
00132         {
00133     //  cout << "A: " << A << endl;
00134       cout << "pivotRowIndex " << pivotRowIndex << endl;
00135       cout << "pivotColIndex " << pivotColIndex << endl;
00136       cout << "Basis: ";
00137       for (int i = 0; i < basis.size(); i++)
00138         cout << basis[i] << " ";
00139       cout << endl;
00140     }
00141 #endif //BT_DEBUG_OSTREAM
00142 
00143         if (!greaterZero)
00144         {
00145 
00146       if (maxloops == 0) {
00147                   maxloops = 100;
00148 //        maxloops = UINT_MAX; //TODO: not a really nice way, problem is: maxloops should be 2^dim (=1<<dim), but this could exceed UINT_MAX and thus the result would be 0 and therefore the lemke algorithm wouldn't start but probably would find a solution within less then UINT_MAX steps. Therefore this constant is used as a upper border right now...
00149       }
00150 
00151       /*start looping*/
00152       for(steps = 0; steps < maxloops; steps++) {
00153 
00154         GaussJordanEliminationStep(A, pivotRowIndex, pivotColIndex, basis);
00155 #ifdef BT_DEBUG_OSTREAM
00156         if (DEBUGLEVEL >= 3) {
00157         //  cout << "A: " << A << endl;
00158           cout << "pivotRowIndex " << pivotRowIndex << endl;
00159           cout << "pivotColIndex " << pivotColIndex << endl;
00160           cout << "Basis: ";
00161           for (int i = 0; i < basis.size(); i++)
00162             cout << basis[i] << " ";
00163           cout << endl;
00164         }
00165 #endif //BT_DEBUG_OSTREAM
00166 
00167         int pivotColIndexOld = pivotColIndex;
00168 
00169         /*find new column index */
00170         if (basis[pivotRowIndex] < dim) //if a w-value left the basis get in the correspondent z-value
00171           pivotColIndex = basis[pivotRowIndex] + dim;
00172         else
00173           //else do it the other way round and get in the corresponding w-value
00174           pivotColIndex = basis[pivotRowIndex] - dim;
00175 
00176         /*the column becomes part of the basis*/
00177         basis[pivotRowIndex] = pivotColIndexOld;
00178 
00179         pivotRowIndex = findLexicographicMinimum(A, pivotColIndex);
00180 
00181         if(z0Row == pivotRowIndex) { //if z0 leaves the basis the solution is found --> one last elimination step is necessary
00182           GaussJordanEliminationStep(A, pivotRowIndex, pivotColIndex, basis);
00183           basis[pivotRowIndex] = pivotColIndex; //update basis
00184           break;
00185       }
00186 
00187       }
00188 #ifdef BT_DEBUG_OSTREAM
00189       if(DEBUGLEVEL >= 1) {
00190         cout << "Number of loops: " << steps << endl;
00191         cout << "Number of maximal loops: " << maxloops << endl;
00192       }
00193 #endif //BT_DEBUG_OSTREAM
00194 
00195       if(!validBasis(basis)) {
00196         info = -1;
00197 #ifdef BT_DEBUG_OSTREAM
00198         if(DEBUGLEVEL >= 1)
00199           cerr << "Lemke-Algorithm ended with Ray-Termination (no valid solution)." << endl;
00200 #endif //BT_DEBUG_OSTREAM
00201 
00202         return solutionVector;
00203       }
00204 
00205     }
00206 #ifdef BT_DEBUG_OSTREAM
00207     if (DEBUGLEVEL >= 2) {
00208      // cout << "A: " << A << endl;
00209       cout << "pivotRowIndex " << pivotRowIndex << endl;
00210       cout << "pivotColIndex " << pivotColIndex << endl;
00211     }
00212 #endif //BT_DEBUG_OSTREAM
00213 
00214     for (int i = 0; i < basis.size(); i++)
00215         {
00216       solutionVector[basis[i]] = A(i,2*dim+1);//q_[i];
00217         }
00218 
00219     info = 0;
00220 
00221     return solutionVector;
00222   }
00223 
00224   int btLemkeAlgorithm::findLexicographicMinimum(const btMatrixXu& A, const int & pivotColIndex) {
00225           int RowIndex = 0;
00226           int dim = A.rows();
00227           btAlignedObjectArray<btVectorXu> Rows;
00228           for (int row = 0; row < dim; row++) 
00229           {
00230 
00231                   btVectorXu vec(dim + 1);
00232                   vec.setZero();//, INIT, 0.)
00233                   Rows.push_back(vec);
00234                   btScalar a = A(row, pivotColIndex);
00235                   if (a > 0) {
00236                           Rows[row][0] = A(row, 2 * dim + 1) / a;
00237                           Rows[row][1] = A(row, 2 * dim) / a;
00238                           for (int j = 2; j < dim + 1; j++)
00239                                   Rows[row][j] = A(row, j - 1) / a;
00240 
00241 #ifdef BT_DEBUG_OSTREAM
00242                 //              if (DEBUGLEVEL) {
00243                         //        cout << "Rows(" << row << ") = " << Rows[row] << endl;
00244                                 // }
00245 #endif 
00246                   }
00247           }
00248 
00249           for (int i = 0; i < Rows.size(); i++) 
00250           {
00251                   if (Rows[i].nrm2() > 0.) {
00252 
00253                           int j = 0;
00254                           for (; j < Rows.size(); j++) 
00255                           {
00256                                   if(i != j)
00257                                   {
00258                                           if(Rows[j].nrm2() > 0.)
00259                                           {
00260                                                   btVectorXu test(dim + 1);
00261                                                   for (int ii=0;ii<dim+1;ii++)
00262                                                   {
00263                                                           test[ii] = Rows[j][ii] - Rows[i][ii];
00264                                                   }
00265 
00266                                                   //=Rows[j] - Rows[i]
00267                                                   if (! LexicographicPositive(test))
00268                                                           break;
00269                                           }
00270                                   }
00271                           }
00272 
00273                           if (j == Rows.size()) 
00274                           {
00275                                   RowIndex += i;
00276                                   break;
00277                           }
00278                   }
00279           }
00280 
00281           return RowIndex;
00282   }
00283 
00284   bool btLemkeAlgorithm::LexicographicPositive(const btVectorXu & v)
00285 {
00286     int i = 0;
00287   //  if (DEBUGLEVEL)
00288     //  cout << "v " << v << endl;
00289 
00290     while(i < v.size()-1 && fabs(v[i]) < btMachEps())
00291       i++;
00292     if (v[i] > 0)
00293       return true;
00294 
00295     return false;
00296   }
00297 
00298 void btLemkeAlgorithm::GaussJordanEliminationStep(btMatrixXu& A, int pivotRowIndex, int pivotColumnIndex, const btAlignedObjectArray<int>& basis) 
00299 {
00300 
00301         btScalar a = -1 / A(pivotRowIndex, pivotColumnIndex);
00302 #ifdef BT_DEBUG_OSTREAM
00303         cout << A << std::endl;
00304 #endif
00305 
00306     for (int i = 0; i < A.rows(); i++)
00307         {
00308       if (i != pivotRowIndex)
00309           {
00310         for (int j = 0; j < A.cols(); j++)
00311                 {
00312           if (j != pivotColumnIndex)
00313                   {
00314                           btScalar v = A(i, j);
00315                           v += A(pivotRowIndex, j) * A(i, pivotColumnIndex) * a;
00316             A.setElem(i, j, v);
00317                   }
00318                 }
00319           }
00320         }
00321 
00322 #ifdef BT_DEBUG_OSTREAM
00323         cout << A << std::endl;
00324 #endif //BT_DEBUG_OSTREAM
00325     for (int i = 0; i < A.cols(); i++) 
00326         {
00327       A.mulElem(pivotRowIndex, i,-a);
00328     }
00329 #ifdef BT_DEBUG_OSTREAM
00330         cout << A << std::endl;
00331 #endif //#ifdef BT_DEBUG_OSTREAM
00332 
00333     for (int i = 0; i < A.rows(); i++)
00334         {
00335       if (i != pivotRowIndex)
00336           {
00337         A.setElem(i, pivotColumnIndex,0);
00338           }
00339         }
00340 #ifdef BT_DEBUG_OSTREAM
00341         cout << A << std::endl;
00342 #endif //#ifdef BT_DEBUG_OSTREAM
00343   }

00345   bool btLemkeAlgorithm::greaterZero(const btVectorXu & vector)
00346 {
00347     bool isGreater = true;
00348     for (int i = 0; i < vector.size(); i++) {
00349       if (vector[i] < 0) {
00350         isGreater = false;
00351         break;
00352       }
00353     }
00354 
00355     return isGreater;
00356   }
00357 
00358   bool btLemkeAlgorithm::validBasis(const btAlignedObjectArray<int>& basis) 
00359   {
00360     bool isValid = true;
00361     for (int i = 0; i < basis.size(); i++) {
00362       if (basis[i] >= basis.size() * 2) { //then z0 is in the base
00363         isValid = false;
00364         break;
00365       }
00366     }
00367 
00368     return isValid;
00369   }
